p: where IR_SRR is calculated for each growing stage using the monthly IR_SRR estimated with the WSM module prorated by the share of each month within each growing stage. The term (ET x crop , cnt , gsc − ET a crop , cnt , gsc) represents the crop irrigation requirements at the root to obtain maximum yield. An IR_SRR = 1 would imply that all the water required for irrigation is available. On the other hand, an IR_SRR = 0 means that none of the water necessary for irrigation is available and therefore irrigated crop yields are similar to rainfed crop yields.
